most_active_tickets.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI

common_issues.title: LTM Context Not Available in Pieces CLI
common_issues.description: Pieces CLI fails to retrieve context from Long Term Memory (LTM) resulting in a 404 error for the Gemini-Pro model.  This occurs on Windows OS with Pieces OS 11.3.6.  Both CLI and Pieces Desktop chat exhibit the same issue, indicating a problem with LTM integration rather than the specific interface.

related_issues.title: LTM not working in Pieces CLI
related_issues.text:
LTM not working in Pieces CLI
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Pieces CLI, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.6

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Screenshot from CLI:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/949b363d-bbd3-4f3a-b128-5211ca2ef765)

Same question from a chat in Pieces Desktop instead:
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/8d3e98a3-e311-46d3-acba-678e286a4bcd)

Pieces CLI doesn't seem to get the context from LTM.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Investigate and resolve the LTM integration issue affecting the Pieces CLI on Windows OS, specifically the 404 error related to the Gemini-Pro model. This appears to be the most frequent and impactful issue currently reported.
Prioritize addressing issue #713, "LTM not working in Pieces CLI," as it has the highest activity level and directly relates to the prevalent LTM integration problem.
Monitor incoming support tickets for similar LTM-related issues across different operating systems and Pieces versions to identify potential broader trends or underlying causes.
Consider improving error messaging and documentation regarding LTM integration to provide users with more specific guidance and troubleshooting steps.
Proactively communicate the status and resolution of the LTM integration issue to affected users to manage expectations and improve user satisfaction.
Analyze the root cause of the LTM integration issue to prevent similar problems from occurring in the future and improve the overall stability of the Pieces CLI and LTM interaction.
Implement automated testing to cover LTM integration scenarios across various operating systems and Pieces versions to catch potential regressions early in the development process.
Explore potential improvements to the LTM integration process, such as enhanced error handling and more robust communication between the CLI and LTM.
Gather additional user feedback on the LTM integration experience to identify any usability issues or areas for improvement.
Consider providing alternative solutions or workarounds for users affected by the LTM integration issue while a permanent fix is being developed and implemented.
Review and update the support documentation and FAQs to address the LTM integration issue and provide clear instructions for troubleshooting and resolution.
Train support staff on the LTM integration issue and its resolution to ensure they can effectively assist users experiencing this problem.
Monitor the effectiveness of the implemented solutions and track the resolution rate of LTM-related support tickets to measure the impact of the improvements made.
Establish a process for proactively identifying and addressing potential LTM integration issues before they impact a large number of users.
Continuously monitor and evaluate the performance and stability of the LTM integration to ensure its reliability and prevent future disruptions to user workflows.
Communicate any planned maintenance or updates related to LTM integration to users in advance to minimize disruption and manage expectations.
Develop a comprehensive troubleshooting guide for LTM integration issues to empower users to resolve common problems independently.
Consider implementing a feedback mechanism within the Pieces CLI to allow users to easily report LTM-related issues and provide valuable insights for improvement.
Explore the possibility of integrating automated diagnostics and troubleshooting tools into the Pieces CLI to streamline the support process and reduce resolution time.
Analyze support ticket data regularly to identify emerging trends and proactively address potential issues related to LTM integration or other aspects of the Pieces platform.
Collaborate with the development team to prioritize and address LTM integration issues and ensure that fixes are thoroughly tested and validated before release.

Investigate the feasibility of implementing a self-service knowledge base or community forum to provide users with a platform for sharing solutions and troubleshooting tips related to LTM integration.
Develop a system for tracking and analyzing user feedback on LTM integration to identify areas for improvement and prioritize future development efforts.
Consider offering training or educational resources to users on how to effectively utilize LTM integration and troubleshoot common issues.
Establish clear communication channels between the support team and the development team to facilitate efficient collaboration and issue resolution.
Regularly review and update the support processes and procedures to ensure they are aligned with the evolving needs of users and the latest developments in the Pieces platform.
Promote the use of the Pieces CLI and LTM integration through tutorials, webinars, and other educational materials to increase user adoption and awareness.
Encourage users to report any issues or feedback related to LTM integration to help improve the overall user experience and ensure the continued stability and reliability of the platform.

Continuously monitor industry best practices and emerging technologies related to LTM integration and knowledge management to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement within the Pieces platform.
Foster a culture of continuous improvement within the support team by encouraging feedback, knowledge sharing, and ongoing professional development.

Develop a comprehensive support strategy that encompasses proactive monitoring, efficient issue resolution, and continuous improvement to ensure the highest level of user satisfaction and platform stability.
Establish service level agreements (SLAs) for LTM integration-related support requests to manage user expectations and ensure timely resolution of issues.
Regularly assess the effectiveness of the support team and identify areas for improvement in terms of response time, resolution rate, and user satisfaction.
Implement a system for tracking and measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) related to LTM integration support to monitor progress and identify areas for optimization.
Develop a comprehensive onboarding process for new support team members to ensure they are adequately trained on LTM integration and other relevant aspects of the Pieces platform.
Foster a collaborative environment between the support team and other departments within the organization to ensure seamless communication and efficient issue resolution.
